User provide high-level research directi.Format: Research topic and domain focus specified in system configuration.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: Keywords such as 'Protein Science', 'Protein Folding' guide literature and data retrieval.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the scientific scope for automated hypothesis generation and retrieval.

User provide research papers.Format: Scientific literature (PDFs, metadata, abstracts) retrieved via APIs.
User provide research papers.Example: arXiv papers on protein science downloaded and parsed.
User provide research papers.Role in workflow: Provides empirical and theoretical context for hypothesis generation.

User provide datasets other than researc.Format: Structured experimental datasets in CSV format.
User provide datasets other than researc.Example: Protein sequence and property datasets loaded via CSVLoader.
User provide datasets other than researc.Role in workflow: Supplies empirical data for pattern extraction and hypothesis grounding.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: Multi-agent LLM pipeline splits hypothesis generation into sequential phases: initial, refined, and specialized evaluation.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: Phase-specific hypothesis lists, each refined by different agent roles.
Workflow Decomposition.Example: Phase 1: initial hypotheses; Phase 2: refined by general agents; Phase 3: scored by protein-specialized agents.
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables systematic, multi-stage hypothesis refinement and evaluation.

Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Method details: Text chunks embedded using SentenceTransformers; structured data embedded with Google-GenerativeAIEmbeddings.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Inputs: Preprocessed literature text and structured data features.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Outputs: High-dimensional vector embeddings stored in FAISS DB.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Example: Chunks from arXiv papers and CSV features embedded for semantic retrieval.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Role in workflow: Supports semantic retrieval and context-aware hypothesis generation.

Pattern and Feature Extraction.Method details: Extracts features (e.g., sequence motifs, secondary structure) and handles missing data from CSV datasets.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Outputs: Feature vectors and descriptive summaries for each protein entry.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Example: Identifies glycine-rich regions, hydrophobic patches, or secondary structure motifs.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Role in workflow: Provides empirical patterns for hypothesis formulation.

Property and Annotation Extraction.Method details: Extracts labels, functional annotations, and physicochemical properties from structured datasets.
Property and Annotation Extraction.Inputs: CSV files with annotated protein data.
Property and Annotation Extraction.Outputs: Annotated features (e.g., label positions, stability metrics).
Property and Annotation Extraction.Role in workflow: Enables mapping of structural features to biological function.

Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Method details: Processes sequence and secondary structure columns to identify motifs and folding patterns.
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Inputs: Protein sequence and structure data from CSV.
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Outputs: Identified sequence motifs, secondary structure elements.
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Example: Extracts alpha-helix and loop regions from 'ss8_seq' column.
Sequence and Structure Feature Extractio.Role in workflow: Informs hypothesis generation about structure-function relationships.

Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Method details: Queries arXiv API with domain-specific keywords to retrieve relevant papers and metadata.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Outputs: Titles, abstracts, PDFs, and metadata for relevant papers.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Example: Automated retrieval of protein science papers from arXiv.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Role in workflow: Populates the literature corpus for embedding and hypothesis generation.

Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Method details: Uses FAISS vector similarity search to retrieve semantically relevant literature and data chunks.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Inputs: Embedded vectors of literature and structured data.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Example: Retrieves literature segments most similar to a protein science query.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Role in workflow: Ensures contextually relevant information is used for hypothesis synthesis.

Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Method details: Uses domain-specific keywords for targeted literature retrieval.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Example: Retrieves only protein science literature from arXiv.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Role in workflow: Focuses retrieval on the scientific domain of interest.

Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Method details: Loads structured experimental datasets (e.g., protein CSVs) via utility modules like LangChain's CSVLoader.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Outputs: Processed datasets for embedding and analysis.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Example: Loads and preprocesses protein property datasets.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Role in workflow: Provides empirical data for hypothesis grounding.

Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Method details: Extracts titles, abstracts, main hypotheses, and results from retrieved papers.
Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Inputs: Full-text or metadata of scientific papers.
Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Example: Summarizes key elements of a paper for RAG input.
Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Role in workflow: Normalizes literature for downstream embedding and reasoning.

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Method details: Summarizes main ideas and key results from each paper using RAG queries.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Example: Summarizes LLPS findings from a crystallization paper.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Role in workflow: Condenses literature for efficient hypothesis context.

Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Method details: Extracts specific fields (e.g., main hypothesis, summary of results) from each paper.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Example: Extracts 'main hypothesis' and 'summary of results' for each paper.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Role in workflow: Enables targeted reasoning and evidence mapping.

Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Method details: Extracts domain-relevant insights (e.g., protein folding, LLPS mechanisms) from literature.
Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Example: Extracts findings on glycine-rich regions in LLPS.
Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Role in workflow: Aligns extracted knowledge with protein science domain.

Literature Database Construction.Method details: Stores processed literature and data embeddings in FAISS vector DB and JSON files.
Literature Database Construction.Outputs: Queryable vector database and JSON logs.
Literature Database Construction.Example: FAISS DB for fast similarity search across literature and data.

LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Method details: Multi-agent LLM system assigns specialized roles (e.g., Internal Consistency, Feasibility) to agents for hypothesis refinement.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Example: Agents clarify assumptions, improve experimental designs, and suggest references.

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: Protein-specialized agents (BioAgent, MolAgent, etc.) evaluate hypotheses for domain-specific criteria.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: EvoAgent checks evolutionary consistency; DrugAgent assesses therapeutic relevance.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Ensures hypotheses are relevant and feasible in protein science.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: RAG retrieves literature segments as context for LLM-based hypothesis generation.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Inputs: Relevant literature chunks from FAISS DB.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Hypotheses on LLPS informed by recent crystallization studies.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Anchors hypothesis generation in empirical evidence.

Summarization Literature data used durin.Method details: Summarized literature insights are included in the hypothesis prompt structure.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Example: Background insight from LLPS literature included in hypothesis template.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Role in workflow: Ensures hypotheses are concise and evidence-based.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Method details: Combines literature-derived insights and structured data patterns in a four-step hypothesis template.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Inputs: Extracted literature facets and dataset patterns.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Example: Combines glycine-rich region pattern with LLPS literature to propose new hypothesis.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Role in workflow: Fosters innovation by integrating diverse evidence.

Idea/hypothesis generation via contructe.Method details: Uses Chain-of-Thought (CoT) reasoning in multi-agent evaluation to trace logical underpinnings.
Idea/hypothesis generation via contructe.Inputs: Initial and refined hypotheses, literature context.
Idea/hypothesis generation via contructe.Example: Agents identify contradictions or missing arguments in hypothesis logic.
Idea/hypothesis generation via contructe.Role in workflow: Ensures logical rigor and transparency in hypothesis development.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Method details: Identifies empirical patterns (e.g., sequence motifs, hydrophobic patches) from structured data for hypothesis input.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Example: Detects conserved hydrophobic patches linked to protein flexibility.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Role in workflow: Grounds hypotheses in observed data trends.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Method details: Links structural features (e.g., alpha-helices, hydrophobic cores) to predicted functional properties in hypotheses.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Example: Hypothesis: conserved alpha-helices predict protein essentiality.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Role in workflow: Connects empirical features to functional predictions.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: General-purpose LLM agents assess internal consistency, feasibility, novelty, impact, and scalability.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Internal Consistency agent checks logical coherence.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Protein-specialized agents score hypotheses on molecular stability, biochemical plausibility, etc.
Agents use literature and data context to support or flag hypotheses.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Hypotheses failing threshold scores are flagged for reprocessing.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Prioritizes hypotheses with strong supporting evidence.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Method details: Novelty Assessment agent checks if hypotheses introduce unique or underexplored concepts.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Example: Agent flags hypotheses overlapping with existing literature.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Alignment.Method details: Chain-of-Thought reasoning ensures hypotheses align with established scientific logic.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Alignment.Example: Agents trace logical progression from literature to hypothesis.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Method details: Specialized agents assign numerical scores (1â€“3) for aspects like molecular stability, functional relevance.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Protein-specialized agents map hypotheses to experimental strategies (e.g., mutagenesis, molecular dynamics).
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Suggests mutagenesis to test glycine-rich region hypothesis.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Links hypotheses to concrete, testable experiments.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Agents assign hypotheses to domain-appropriate experimental methods (e.g., NMR, cryo-EM, simulations).
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Maps flexibility hypothesis to NMR spectroscopy.

Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Method details: Suggests computational validation (e.g., molecular dynamics simulations) as part of experimental strategy.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Example: Proposes molecular dynamics to assess phase behavior changes.

Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Method details: Multi-agent system iteratively critiques and refines hypotheses based on agent scoring and validation mapping.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Example: Hypotheses failing agent thresholds are reprocessed.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Role in workflow: Ensures only robust, validated hypotheses proceed.

paper_title: PROTEINHYPOTHESIS: A PHYSICS-AWARE CHAIN OF MULTI-AGENT RAG LLM FOR HYPOTHESIS GENER- ATION IN PROTEIN SCIENCE
